alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 4:12PM MDT until July 08 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE CERRO PELADO BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTY... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms ending over the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Between 0.25 and 1 inch of rain has fallen over central and southeast parts of the scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Canada Camada, Peralta Canyon, Bland Canyon, Rio Chiquito, Tent Rocks National Monument, Cochiti Pueblo, and Cochiti Golf Club. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cochiti Pueblo and Pena Blanca. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the southern and eastern part of the Cerro Pelado fire burn area. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
